title: Firewall Access Rule for a Zone
description: An IP, IP range, or country specific firewall rule applied directly to a zone or inherited from user or account-level rules.
cfExtendedDescription:
Access Rules are a way to allow, challenge, or block requests to your website based on the IP address, IP address range, or country of the browser making the request.

You can apply Access Rules to one zone only or all zones in your account. See the User-level or Account-level access rules endpoints for creating rules that are applied across all zones owned by the user or account.

links.title: List Access Rules
links.description: Search, sort, and filter IP/country access rules

per_page.description: Maximum number of results per page. This can only be provided as 1 or in multiples of 5 such as 5, 10, 15 or 20

mode.description: The action to apply to a matched request

configuration.value.description: Search by IP, range, or country code
configuration.value.cfNotes: IP is a single IPv4 address. IP range has a subnet of /16 or /24. Country code is an ISO 2-letter country code.

notes.description: Search in the access rules by notes.
notes.cfNotes: Matching any string within previously created access rules with the notes. For example, access rules with notes 'Attack 26/02' & 'Attack 27/02' would both match string 'attack'. Search is not case sensitive.

match.description: Whether to match all search requirements or at least one (any)

links.title: Create Access Rule
links.description: Make a new IP, IP range, or country access rule for the zone. Note: If you would like to create an access rule that applies across all of your owned zones, use the user or account firewall endpoints as appropriate.
links.curl:
curl -X POST "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/firewall/access_rules/rules" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"mode":"challenge","configuration":{"target":"ip","value":"198.51.100.4"},"notes":"This rule is on because of an event that occured on date X"}'

mode.description: The action to apply to a matched request

value.description: The IP address to target in requests
The IP address to target in requests
The IP range to target in requests. Limited to /16 and /24 for IPv4 and /32, /48 and /64 for IPv6.
The AS number to target in requests.
The 2-digit country code to target in requests. The full list of valid country codes can be found [here](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/205072537)

notes.example: "This rule is on because of an event that occured on date X"
notes.description: A personal note about the rule. Typically used as a reminder or explanation for the rule.

links.title: Edit Access Rule
links.description: Update rule state and/or note for the zone. Note: you can only edit rules in the 'zone' group via this endpoint. Use the appropriate owner rules endpoint if trying to manage owner-level rules
links.curl:
curl -X PATCH "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/firewall/access_rules/rules/92f17202ed8bd63d69a66b86a49a8f6b" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"mode":"challenge","notes":"This rule is on because of an event that occured on date X"}'

mode.description: The action to apply to a matched request

notes.example: "This rule is on because of an event that occured on date X"
notes.description: A personal note about the rule. Typically used as a reminder or explanation for the rule.

links.title: Delete Access Rule
links.description: Remove an access rule so it is no longer evaluated during requests. Optionally, specify how to delete rules that match the mode and configuration across all other zones that this zone owner manages. 'none' is the default, and will only delete this rule. 'basic' will delete rules that match the same mode and configuration. 'aggressive' will delete rules that match the same configuration.

cascade.description: The level to attempt to delete rules defined on other zones that are similar to this rule

notes.example: "This rule is on because of an event that occured on date X"
notes.description: A personal note about the rule. Typically used as a reminder or explanation for the rule.

allowed_modes.description: The possible modes the rule can be in.

items.description: The action to apply to a matched request

mode.description: The action to apply to a matched request

value.description: The IP address to target in requests
The IP address to target in requests
The IP range to target in requests. Limited to /16 and /24 for IPv4 and /32, /48 and /64 for IPv6.
The AS number to target in requests.
The 2-digit country code to target in requests. The full list of valid country codes can be found [here](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/205072537)

modified_on.description: When the rule was last modified

oneOf.description: All zones owned by the user will have the rule applied.
All zones owned by the account will have the rule applied.
All zones owned by the organization will have the rule applied.
Only this specific zone will have the rule applied.

scope.description: Information about the scope of the rule

object_definition.title: Firewall Access Rule for a Zone
object_definition.description: An IP, IP range, or country specific firewall rule applied directly to a zone or inherited from user or account-level rules.
